title.narrative: Promoting Investments in the Fight against Climate Change and Ecosystems Protection through Integrated Renewable Energy and Biomass Solutions for Productive Uses and Industrial Applications - Preparatory Assistance Phase (PA/PPG)

description.narrative:
Project Preparation Grant (PPG) predecessor of the main Project ID 120335: The PIF for this project has been submitted for CEO clearance. A detailed assessment of the energy sector and the role for renewable energy in addressing the energy deficit in Cameroon was done at the PIF stage, indicating the baseline and GEF alternative project and its potential global environmental benefits. However, at that stage the baseline information was limited and so PPG activities are requested to allow for a more detailed baseline assessment for elaborating the project document and to establish a more informed assessment of the GEF alternative project and its incremental costs, global environmental benefits and cost effectiveness. The requested PPG activities will consist of :
1. Detailed baseline assessment. This component of the PPG will carry out a detailed evaluation of the baseline data gap and the collection and analysis of the required data to accurately assess the baseline project. The activities will include assessment of existing energy policies and strategies, energy demand and supply, regulatory framework, institutional and sectoral capacities and issues, and a detailed assessment of the existing finance and investment environment in the country.
2. Formulation of the GEF alternative project Here the PPG activities will quantify the incremental aspects, global benefits and cost effectiveness of the GEF project by carrying out a more detailed study and identification of the incremental critical policy, capacity, technological, financial and institutional barriers that need to be addressed in order to promote investments in renewable energy generation in Cameroon. The activities here will also include identification of a framework for the design of the Cameroon Renewable Energy Investment Fund (CREIF).
3. Stakeholder consultation The activities here will establish dialogue and consultation with various stakeholders in order to establish roles, co-financing and other commitments. The stakeholders will include government ministries, local and regional banks, private sector (including members of the Cameroon association of industries, GICAM, as well as entrepreneurs and SMEs), Civil Society Organisations, universities and research institutions, and multilateral and bilateral donors. The activities will include a stakeholder buy-in workshop and establishment of the national project implementation structure.
4. Identification of project demonstration sites This component of the PPG will involve (i) a quantitative assessment of the renewable energy resources of the country and their geographic distribution, (ii) identification of productive activity areas and value chain opportunities in the country, particularly with regards to agro processing installations and their associated biomass residues and renewable energy generation potential , (iii) selection of potential project demonstration sites, including appropriate technologies assessment, feasibility studies and socioeconomic surveys for each site
5. Assessment of linkages and synergies with related activities The PPG activities here will involve (i) carrying out a detailed assessment of related existing and pipeline projects and mapping out their linkages and synergies with the GEF project, and (ii) dialogue and consultation with operators of the identified projects in order to agree areas of supplementary and complementary activities.
6. Detail project design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation plan This component will provide a detailed design of the full project based on the results of the above activities and will include project scope and logframe, budgeting and costing to assign incremental and baseline co-financing costs to various project components and the associated activities.
